primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The transition of Christ from physical limitation to universal spiritual power through the Ascension, enabling His followers to perform 'greater works' through His intercession.

object.identificatie: The 'Greater Works' (Universal witness, healing, and spiritual presence)
tekstueel_bewijs: greater works than these shall he do
new powers would be turned loose
because I go unto my Father
that the Father may be glorified in the Son

helper.identificatie: The Ascension / The Death and Resurrection
tekstueel_bewijs: because I go unto my Father
He could not be both here and there
limited himself to being in only one place
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The limitation is ontological—the constraint of the Incarnation itself must be overcome by the Ascension to reach the world.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer performing works and praying in Jesus' name.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The believer's 'doing' is entirely contingent upon Christ's 'going' to the Father.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: The Father → Greater Works → The Believer

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Ability' (Pouvoir) of Christ which is then shared with the believer. It is a theology of empowerment through union with the Ascended Lord.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From the 'Riddle' of S2 (limitation) to the 'Answer' of S1 (universal power via the Father).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'going to the Father' which transforms a loss (physical absence) into a gain (spiritual ubiquity).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the preacher emphasizes that without the Ascension, the Gospel would be a localized, inaccessible phenomenon.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. While it speaks of the believer 'doing' works, the 'engine' of the action is Christ's status at the right hand of God. The believer is the beneficiary of Christ's movement.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: the works that I do shall he do also

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Whatsoever ye shall ask in my name, that will I do
innocent for the guilty, the good for the bad

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures are used as evidence of Christ's power, not as models for human imitation.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: These are 'made-whole' and 'second-chance' people—objects of Christ's action.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and hope; the burden of 'greater works' is shifted to Christ's intercessory power.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The 'riddle' structure perfectly integrates the biblical text with the theological conclusion.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: the innocent for the guilty, the good for the bad, how he offered himself a ransom for many

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon attributes the 'Pouvoir' to the Ascended Christ directly rather than explicitly naming the Holy Spirit, though the function is pneumatological.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: High; requires a 'ransom' and 'shedding of blood'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God/Christ as the Subject of the primary narrative. The 'greater works' of the believer are correctly framed as the fruit of Christ's heavenly session.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is a strong grace-orientation.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The preacher could slightly increase the role of the Holy Spirit as the 'Helper' actant to clarify *how* the power is transmitted.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The 'Opponent' of physical limitation is well-developed.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterpiece of theocentric preaching that resolves a difficult text by shifting the actantial focus from human effort to Christ's post-Ascension agency.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'riddle' metaphor; Greimas shows that the riddle is actually a structural shift in the Subject's location.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Greek; semiotics explains why the 'greater works' don't turn into a 'to-do list' for the congregation.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'greater works' are only possible because the Subject (Christ) changed His modal competence from 'Localized' to 'Universal'.

appendices.notities: The sermon avoids the trap of 'moral exemplarism' by framing the 'greater works' as a result of Christ's status, not the believer's virtue.
